Class Instructor

java.lang.Object
Person
Instructor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Demonstrator, Teacher
public abstract class Instructor
extends Person
This class defines an Instructor object. It provides all the properties and methods necessary to manage an instructor in the bigger context of the School. Each instructor, apart from the properties inherited from Person, has also an assignedCourses ArrayList containing all the courses the instructor has been assigned and methods to: assign or unassign a Course, get the assigned courses, see if he or she can teach a specific Subject and and pretty-print all instructors's details. Each instructor type subclass will have its own level of specialism, this will influence what subjects can teach.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Giovanni Arcudi

    • assignCourse

      public void assignCourse​(Course course)
      Adds the input Course to the instructor's assignedCourses ArrayList.
      Parameters:

    • unassignCourse

    • getAssignedCourses

      public java.util.ArrayList<Course> getAssignedCourses()
      Instructor's assignedCourses ArrayList accessor method.
      Returns:
      the ArrayList containing all the courses assigned to the instructor

    • canTeach

      public abstract boolean canTeach​(Subject subject)
      Tells if an instructor can teach a Subject or not. This abstract method will be overridden by the Instructor's subclasses.
      Parameters:
      subject - the subject we want to check if can be taught by the instructor
      Returns:
      true if the instructor can teach the input subject, false otherwise

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a pretty-print String of the Instructor.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a table-formatted string containing the Instructor's name, gender, age, type and assigned courses.
